FuncDef: The reset pim ipv6 routing-table all command deletes PIM status information from all IPv6 PIM routing entries.
CLIs: reset pim ipv6 vpn-instance <instance-name> routing-table all

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If PIM status information in all IPv6 PIM routing entries is unnecessary, run the reset pim ipv6 routing-table all command. After this command is run, PIM will terminate IPv6 multicast data forwarding.
Precautions
The reset pim ipv6 routing-table all command deletes PIM status information of downstream interfaces, but does not delete MLD or static group join status information.
